Question Text: Do you need any more information to complete the assessment?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to reflect upon whether you think that you need further information to obtain a comprehensive view of the impact of the Function.

The Impact section asked you to identify existing information to assess the impact of the function on individuals of different ages.

The Consultation section asked you to who had been consulted about the impact of the Function.

Even with these two sources of information you may feel that there is additional information required such as further data collection and analysis of further consultation.

Question Text: Please explain what information you need.
Question Help Text: A brief description of the nature of the information, source and timescales for collection will be sufficient.

Question Text: Is there any more work you feel is necessary to complete the assessment?
Do you think that the Function has a role in preventing individuals of different ages being treated differently, in an unfair or inappropriate way, just because of their age?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to assess whether the Function could have a role in eliminating discrimination or harassment faced by individuals of different ages as a result of their individuals of different ages.

There will be a minority of Functions that are intended to eliminate discrimination or harassment as their primary purpose and some Functions which might have a secondary role in eliminating discrimination or harassment.

Question Text: Do you think that the Function could assist individuals of different ages to get on better with each other?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to assess whether the Function could have a role in assisting individuals of different ages to get on better with each other.

There will be a minority of Functions that are intended to promote good relations as their primary purpose and some Functions that might have this as a secondary role.

Question Text: Do you think that the function will take account of disabilities even if it means treating individuals with different kinds of disability more favourably?
Question Help Text:
The question asks whether the Function takes account of disabilities even if it means treating people with disabilities more favourably.

As noted in the Impact section this type of intentional positive impact can be characterized as positive action.

Question Text: Do you think that the Function could assist individuals with different kinds of disability to participate more?
Question Help Text:
The question asks you whether the Function could encourage individuals with different types of disability to participate more in society.

Functions which assisted with access, both physical and information, for people with different types of disability might assist in this regard.

Question Text: Have you obtained the views of individuals of different ages on the impact of the Function?
Question Help Text:
This question asks whether any individuals representing the interests of individuals of different ages have been consulted on the impact of the Function.

The consultation may have been arranged specifically for this particular Function or for a number of Functions.

The available answers to this question are:
  • Yes
  • No
  • Not Sure

Question Text: If not, why not?
Question Help Text:
This question asks why groups have not been consulted on the impact of the Function.

The available answers to this question are:
  • No relevant individuals identified. This would be the correct answer if it had been decided that there were no suitable groups representing the interests of individuals of different ages to consult with.
  • There are plans to consult relevant individuals. This would be the correct answer if the consultation was planned but had not yet taken place.
  • There are no plans to consult relevant individuals. There may be reasons why the Council had decided not to consult on the impact of the Function.
  • Not Sure. As always an acceptable answer if you are unsure.

Question Text: If so, how did you obtain these views?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to list the groups that have been consulted and the date of the consultation.

If any future consultations are planned please record these details as well.

Question Text: Is there anything about the Function and the way it affects individuals of different ages which needs highlighting?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to identify any issues about the way in which the Function has an impact upon people from different religions or beliefs. An issue will be where there is a differential impact. This means that the impact on one particular group of individuals, say elderly people, is different than for another group.

Differential impact can be positive or negative. Negative or adverse differential impact needs to be addressed by putting in place compensatory measures.

Some differential impact is intentional and can be characterised as positive action.

Question Text: What is your assessment of the Function in meeting the needs of individuals of different ages?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to assess the current impact of the Function in meeting the particular needs of individuals of different ages.

The available answers are on a five point scale from 5 excellent to 1 poor and as usual Not sure is also an acceptable answer.

If the Function is not meeting the needs of any individuals of different ages purely because of their individuals of different ages then clearly the impact of the Function in this regard is not positive.

Question Text: Do you have evidence to support the assessment above?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you whether you have any information to support your assessment of the impact of the Function that you recorded in the previous question.

The information could take a wide variety of forms from regular performance management information, evaluation work, surveys, academic publications and audit reports.

The available answers are:
  • Yes
  • No
  • Not Sure
If you have not got information to support the assessment of impact you might like to think on what basis you made the assessment.

Question Text: Please record the type of evidence and where it is from?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to record the nature of the information you have used to make your assessment of the impact.

A brief description of the information, its source and date is sufficient. e.g.
Internal Audit Report.
ABC Ltd
October 2007

Question Text: Do you plan to collect any evidence?
Question Help Text: This question asks you whether the Council has any plans to collect information to assess the impact of the Function.

Question Text: When will you collect the evidence?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to estimate the timescales for collecting additional information.

If you are not sure about the timescales please note this in the space provided.

Question Text: Have any complaints been received about the Function in meeting the particular needs of individuals of different ages?

The available answers to this question are:
  • Yes
  • No
  • Not Sure

In the light of this question you may want to go back and review your assessment of the impact of the Function on individuals of different ages.

Question Text: Please record the nature of any such complaints
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to record the details of any additional measures.

A brief description, source and date will be sufficient.

Question Text: You may have evidence from more than one source.  If so, does it present a consistent view?
Question Help Text: This question asks you whether all the information from the range of sources gives a consistent assessment of the impact of the Function.

Question Text: Is there anything about the Function and the way it affects expecting or new parents which needs highlighting?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to identify any issues about the way in which the Function has an impact upon people from different religions or beliefs. An issue will be where there is a differential impact.

Differential impact can be positive or negative. Negative or adverse differential impact needs to be addressed by putting in place compensatory measures.

Some differential impact is intentional and can be characterised as positive action.

Question Text: What is your assessment of the Function in meeting the needs of individuals from different ethnic backgrounds?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to assess the current impact of the Function in meeting the particular needs of individuals from different ethnic backgrounds.

The available answers are on a five point scale from 5 excellent to 1 poor and as usual Not sure is also an acceptable answer.

If the Function is not meeting the needs of any individuals from different ethnic backgrounds purely because of their individuals from different ethnic backgrounds then clearly the impact of the Function in this regard is not positive.

Question Text: Do you have evidence to support the assessment above?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you whether you have any information to support your assessment of the impact of the Function that you recorded in the previous question.

The information could take a wide variety of forms from regular performance management information, evaluation work, surveys, academic publications and audit reports.

The available answers are:
  • Yes
  • No
  • Not Sure
If you have not got information to support the assessment of impact you might like to think on what basis you made the assessment.

Question Text: Please record the type of evidence and where it is from?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to record the nature of the information you have used to make your assessment of the impact.

A brief description of the information, its source and date is sufficient. e.g.
Internal Audit Report.
ABC Ltd
October 2007

Question Text: Do you plan to collect any evidence?
Question Help Text: This question asks you whether the Council has any plans to collect information to assess the impact of the Function.

Question Text: When will you collect the evidence?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to estimate the timescales for collecting additional information.

If you are not sure about the timescales please note this in the space provided.

Question Text: Have any complaints been received about the Function in meeting the particular needs of individuals from different ethnic backgrounds?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you if there are other measures by which you could assess the impact of the Function on individuals from different ethnic backgrounds. Such measures might be the level of complaints, anecdotal evidence or your first hand experience of the Function.

The available answers to this question are:
  • Yes
  • No
  • Not Sure

In the light of this question you may want to go back and review your assessment of the impact of the Function on individuals from different ethnic backgrounds.

Question Text: Please record the nature of any such complaints
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to record the details of any additional measures.

A brief description, source and date will be sufficient.

Differential impact can be positive or negative. Negative or adverse differential impact needs to be addressed by putting in place compensatory measures.

Some differential impact is intentional and can be characterised as positive action.

Question Text: Does this EINA have any relevance to individuals of different ages?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to identify any positive differential impact that the Function has on individuals of different ages.

. Please indicate whether the Function could affect individuals of different ages differently if it were performed well.

Question Text: Does this EINA have any relevance to individuals with different kinds of disability?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to identify any positive differential impact that the Function has on individuals with different kinds of disability.

It is important to have regards for all types of disability including physical, sensory, learning and mental health.

. Please indicate whether the Function could affect individuals with different kinds of disability differently if it were performed well.

Question Text: Is the Function delivered by a third party?
Were equality requirements part of the contracting process if the Function is delivered by a third party?
Have you any overall comments on this initial stage of the assessment?
Have you any final comments on this assessment?
What is the Function supposed to achieve?
Question Help Text:
This question asks you to identify the target outcome or desired state of affairs which the Function is designed to deliver. If the Function does the job which it is supposed to do, what will it change or achieve.

Examples of target outcomes are:
  • A narrowing of the gap between the local employment rate for priority disadvantaged groups and the national rate.
  • An improvement in the skill levels of the workforce to better meet the needs of the local economy.
It is unlikely that the target outcome will be expressed in terms of numerical targets or outputs.

Question Text: Service users
Question Help Text: Service Users, people who use Council serices whether residents or visitors.  Functions which deliver front line services will have an impact on these individuals.

Question Text: Staff employed by the organisation
Question Help Text: Functions on how the Council is structured and operates such as HR Functions will have an impact on staff employed by the Council.  Staff are almost certain to be Services Users as well but this question is asked in relation to their role as staff.

Question Text: Supplier organisations, staff and customers
Question Help Text: Functions relating to the way in which the Council purchases goods and services may have an impact on staff employed by supplier organisations.  Staff of supplier organisations are almost certain to be Services Users as well but this question is asked in relation to their role purely as staff of supplier organisations.

Question Text: Partner organisations, staff and customers
Question Help Text: Functions that cover the way the Council works with local partners are likely to affect staff of partner organisations.  Staff of partner organisations are almost certain to be Services Users as well but this question is asked in relation to their role purely as staff of partner organisations.

Question Text: Businesses, staff and customers
Question Help Text: Functions which cover the way in which the Council engages with businesses are likely to have an impact on the employees of such businesses
